posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
I've been doing some reading about some of the great Native American leaders, particularly those from the Oglala Lakota people.  I'm wondering how that culture/those warriors could be represented using the NWN game engine.  My own thinking is that Ranger would be a no-brainer as a class, given their outdoor lifestyle.  Tomahawk (hand axe) or Spear would be melee weapon choice, with perhaps a second focus on a bow.  There would be two paths to choose from - the warrior (Crazy Horse) & the holy man (Sitting Bull).

Crazy Horse would be a fierce, stealthy fighter - Ranger/Fighter/Shadow Dancer, perhaps?  Ranger/Rogue/XXX?  Ranger/Harper/XXX?

Sitting Bull would have melee capability, but have divine inclinations - Ranger/Druid/XXX who could assume the form of a hawk or panther, etc., or a Ranger/Cleric/XXX healer, possibly even a charismatic Ranger/Paladin/XXX?

This is really more for roleplay rather than powergaming. 

I saw one RGR/FTR/SD on the old board   http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 17489.html It's decent, but not quite the flavor.

I'd love to see some ideas!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Nice theme Theofilus,

I recall something similar to these classes/setting have been done in DnD 2nd. Ed. but i do not remember the names by heart.

Apart from that and having played this very ranger till about 35th lvl i can only give you a single advice. Do not take many levels away from your Ranger leveling. The final build may look neat but did you notice that Bane of Enemies is not till 35th level? And we are taling about a dexterity build with only 10 strength and the EWS being the only damage factor till BoE. It has good defenses though, but nothing exceptional till Epic Dodge come in 39th level. Moral of the story is, that everything comes late, although the end resault is good.

If you tell us what are you looking for, we may be able to produce a build that's suited to your play style and matures earlier.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
That looks impressive, but I'd rearrange it with single-wield melee first (axe and shield), then ranged, and then dual-wield. I think that would make leveling easier.
I don't see how only 8 points in Spot in epic levels would be very helpful. I'd put 2 of those points in UMD to make it a more-useful multiple of 5, and the other 6 in Lore because that's where I put left-over points.
